comments.body:
change reason:
```
In ./test/e2e_node/environment/setup_host.sh line 45:
if $(sudo systemctl status update-engine &>/dev/null); then
   ^-- SC2091: Remove surrounding $() to avoid executing output.
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +43,47 @@
# For coreos, disable updates
if sudo systemctl status update-engine &>/dev/null; then
  sudo systemctl mask update-engine locksmithd
fi

comments.body:
change reason:
```
In ./test/e2e_node/environment/setup_host.sh line 51:
if [ $? -ne 0 ] ; then
     ^-- SC2181: Check exit code directly with e.g. 'if mycmd;', not indirectly with $?.
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +48,52 @@
# Fixup sudoers require tty
if ! sudo grep -q "# Defaults    requiretty" /etc/sudoers; then
  sudo sed -i 's/Defaults    requiretty/# Defaults    requiretty/' /etc/sudoers
fi

comments.body:
change reason:
```
In ./test/e2e_node/environment/setup_host.sh line 61:
     cd $NSENTER_BUILD_DIR
     ^-------------------^ SC2164: Use 'cd ... || exit' or 'cd ... || return' in case cd fails.
        ^----------------^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.
```
SC2164 is a really dumb rule

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +57,61 @@     echo "Do not find nsenter. Install it."
     NSENTER_BUILD_DIR=$(mktemp -d /tmp/nsenter-build-XXXXXX)
     cd "$NSENTER_BUILD_DIR" || exit 1
     curl https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/util-linux/v2.31/util-linux-2.31.tar.gz | tar -zxf-
     sudo apt-get update

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +62,66 @@     sudo apt-get --yes install make
     sudo apt-get --yes install gcc
     cd util-linux-2.31 || exit 1
     ./configure --without-ncurses
     make nsenter

comments.body: I wonder if there is easier way to install nsenter. But it seems like this is the way to go.
I mostly just copied this from `gce/trusty/configure-helper.sh` and verified that on a trusty instance.
If we want to trust jpetazzo / Dockerhub there's https://github.com/jpetazzo/nsenter#how-do-i-install-nsenter-with-this
Not that I don't trust jeptazzo, but I've already run the script and created the new images. Let's try to stop the bleeding first :-)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +70,74 @@     mkdir -p /tmp/nsenter-install
     cd /tmp/nsenter-install
     curl https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/util-linux/v2.24/util-linux-2.24.tar.gz | tar -zxf-
     sudo apt-get update
     sudo apt-get --yes install make
